content.raw: Yes that makes sense, I tested out your branch and it works well for me, if you want, we can make a quick PR and merge it in here.
content.html: Yes that makes sense, I tested out your branch and it works well for me, if you want, we can make a quick PR and merge it in here.

content.raw: I’m not sure if this API would be useful in the future. What do you think about combining the two function into one `transformAxisAlignedBox` function? Can you take a look at the changes in the [abb\_dome\_transform](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/67c4832601a8414820bccf0aa56eda85ed8f23f1) branch and see if they look good to you? I changed function to lowercase so it follows non-member function naming scheme, and changed `_worldPose` arg to `_pose` since this function should be able to accept any transform.
content.html: I’m not sure if this API would be useful in the future. What do you think about combining the two function into one transformAxisAlignedBox function? Can you take a look at the changes in the abb_dome_transform branch and see if they look good to you? I changed function to lowercase so it follows non-member function naming scheme, and changed _worldPose arg to _pose since this function should be able to accept any transform.

content.html: I added tests as well as recommended improvement so this PR is ready for another review whenever there’s time

content.raw: This update is a forward port of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/76b0a2456babb33fe5916a4e08ae89ffdeb6e682](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/76b0a2456babb33fe5916a4e08ae89ffdeb6e682) which fixes an `Ogre2Material` destruction issue which made tests with `Ogre2Grid` and `Ogre2WireBox` crash upon exiting.
content.html: This update is a forward port of #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/76b0a2456babb33fe5916a4e08ae89ffdeb6e682 which fixes an Ogre2Material destruction issue which made tests with Ogre2Grid and Ogre2WireBox crash upon exiting.

content.raw: I added a check `if (!this->Scene()->IsInitialized())` similar to `OgreMaterial` and this fixes the seg fault, but I believe this could still result in a memory leak - not sure how crucial it would be though considering this case is one that occurs after the scene is destroyed likely meaning end of ignition session
content.html: I added a check if (!this->Scene()->IsInitialized()) similar to OgreMaterial and this fixes the seg fault, but I believe this could still result in a memory leak - not sure how crucial it would be though considering this case is one that occurs after the scene is destroyed likely meaning end of ignition session

content.raw: I was actually just doing some testing and found that a seg fault results due to the scene being destroyed and the engine unloading after which the destructor to the WireBox is called resulting in a seg fault due to a null `this->scene->OgreSceneManager()` what do you think we should do here?

content.raw: we need to override ogre’s `getMovableType()` function like it's done in [gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/cde54284e90b59a9af9fade096946c0cd4a91c44/gazebo/rendering/DynamicLines.cc#lines-62). I don't think we need to call the the extra `GetMovableType` function though
